Job Summary


	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and driving revenue growth within Nigeria&rsquo;s oil and gas value chain.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong technical understanding of the industry, excellent networking ability, and a proven track record of closing deals in oilfield or energy-related services.

	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitors, and partnership opportunities.
	Collaborate with internal technical teams to align business proposals with service delivery capabilities.

	Represent company at trade shows, exhibitions, and industry networking events.

	B.Sc. / HND in Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	5&ndash;7 years of proven experience in business development, marketing, or commercial roles in the Oil &amp; Gas industry.
	Demonstrable understanding of oilfield services, project bidding, and client acquisition in the energy sector.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Strong analytical and market intelligence abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Willingness to travel within and outside Nigeria as business demands.

	Business networking and stakeholder management
	Proposal and tender writing

	Client relationship management
	Commercial and contract negotiation
	Excellent reporting and documentation skills.

	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team in a growing energy company.
	Exposure to large-scale oil and gas projects and strategic partnerships.
	Continuous professional development and career advancement opportunities.

Business Development Specialist Job at Smartwork Outsourcing Limited




        
    

        
        Smartwork Outsourcing Limited is recruiting suitable candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Specialist

Job Location: Island, Lagos (with field assignments across Nigeria)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Oil & Gas / Energy / Engineering Services

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Business Development Specialist will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, managing client relationships, and driving revenue growth within Nigeria’s oil and gas value chain.
	The ideal candidate must possess a strong technical understanding of the industry, excellent networking ability, and a proven track record of closing deals in oilfield or energy-related services.


Key Responsibilities


	Identify, develop, and secure new business opportunities across upstream, midstream, and downstream operations.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, contractors, and regulatory bodies.
	Lead proposal and tender development processes — from bid preparation to presentation.
	Conduct market research to identify industry trends, competitors, and partnership opportunities.
	Collaborate with internal technical teams to align business proposals with service delivery capabilities.
	Prepare regular business performance reports and forecasts for management review.
	Represent company at trade shows, exhibitions, and industry networking events.


Requirements


	B.Sc. / HND in Engineering, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field.
	5–7 years of proven experience in business development, marketing, or commercial roles in the Oil & Gas industry.
	Demonstrable understanding of oilfield services, project bidding, and client acquisition in the energy sector.
	Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
	Strong analytical and market intelligence abilities.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
	Willingness to travel within and outside Nigeria as business demands.


Core Competencies:


	Business networking and stakeholder management
	Proposal and tender writing
	Strategic sales planning and execution
	Client relationship management
	Commercial and contract negotiation
	Excellent reporting and documentation skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
	Opportunity to work with a forward-thinking team in a growing energy company.
	Exposure to large-scale oil and gas projects and strategic partnerships.
	Continuous professional development and career advancement opportunities.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: agrofarm828@gmail.com using “Application - Business Development Specialist – Oil & Gas” as the subject of the mail.

Frontend Developer Job at Stivlon Consulting




        
    

        
        Stivlon Consulting is your strategic partner in building high-performance teams and unlocking individual potential. We are passionate about finding the perfect fit—the talented individuals who elevate your company and the fulfilling career paths that ignite professional growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

            
    




	We're seeking a talented Frontend Engineer to join our development team. You'll be responsible for building responsive, performant, and intuitive user interfaces using modern web technologies.
	This Role offers the opportunity to work on challenging problems and contribute to products that impac our users directly.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain high-quality web applications using Vue 3 and modern JavaScript
	Build real-time features using WebSocket connections for live data updates
	Collaborate with designers, backend engineers, and product managers to deliver exceptional user experiences
	Translate Figma designs into pixel-perfect, responsive user interfaces
	Work closely with design team to review Figma prototypes and provide technical feedback
	Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code following best practices
	Implement responsive designs using Tailwind CSS utility classes
	Manage application state efficiently using Pinia
	Optimize application performance and ensure cross-browser compatibility
	Participate in code reviews and contribute to engineering standards
	Debug and resolve frontend issues in development and production environments
	Stay current with emerging frontend technologies and best practices


Required Skills & Experience


	4+ years of professional frontend development experience
	Strong proficiency in JavaScript (ES6+) and modern web standards
	Extensive experience with Vue 3, including Composition API and component design
	Solid understanding of state management using Pinia or similar libraries
	Experience with real-time communication protocols, particularly WebSocket
	Proficiency with Tailwind CSS and utility-first CSS frameworks.
	Strong ability to translate Figma designs into functional, responsive interfaces
	Experience working with design systems and maintaining design-development consistency
	Understanding of responsive design principles and mobile-first development
	Experience with version control systems, particularly Git
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.


Salary
700,000 Naira Monthly

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: stivlonjobs@gmail.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the email.

  "description": "Shulifang Biotechnology is a fast growing company situated in the Lekki free zone Lagos state. we are into the production of FMCG products such as Detergent, liquid soap, edible oil, PET bottles, face powder, perfumes, etc.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Oregun, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Manage daily logistics operations
	Develop and implement logistics strategies and plans
	Control and optimize logistics costs
	Supervise and manage logistics team
	Communicate and coordinate with suppliers, customers, and third-party logistics providers
	Analyze and report logistics-related data.


Basic Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or above in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related field
	5+ years of logistics management experience, with at least 2 years of experience as a Logistics Manager
	Experience in logistics, warehousing, transportation, or related fields
	Familiarity with logistics management processes and supply chain management principles
	Strong leadership and team management skills
